extendedInfo.description: User Guide : http://tinyurl.com/tdaugNOTE: Fixes the crashes you experience when pressing the > button Much improved conversation view when you swipe right to left on an emailIf you are on an android 4.x device, you will see richer notificationsLocalization for 13 languagesThis version of TouchDown is specially for SmartPhone devices running Android 2.x. This is a 30 day trial which you can activate by purchasing the license key separately.When it comes to corporate data access on your device, you get what you pay for. For a fair comparison, compare the download counts along with the stars.NitroDesk, Inc. has been building and improving TouchDown since October 2008. We have improved the product through hundreds of internal versions, to bring you the best and most downloaded Email solution for Android. Comprehensive : Support for most number of data types (Email, Calendar, Contacts, Tasks) and Notes and SMS syncing for Exchange 2010 servers. Customizable : Dozens of options to make the app behave just the way you want. Custom notifications, speech notifications, viewing tweaks, pinch-to-zoom, peak times and many more.SD card support : Move your data to the SD card if necessaryWidgets : Email, Tasks, Calendar, Universal Widgets make it easy for you to see your status at a glance. Support for third party widgets give you a wide range of choiceMost Secure: TouchDown supports exchange activesync policies such as PIN, Remote Wipe, Data encryption and Storage card encryption of corporate data. Hundreds of organizations trust TouchDown to ensure security, privacy and confidentiality of their data. Discerning organizations mandate the use of TouchDown to ensure high usability along with security. Corporate Data Separation: TouchDown keeps your corporate data separate from your personal data. Without TouchDown, your employer can actually flatten your phone to factory defaults. With TouchDown, they can only remove corporate data belonging to them, leaving behind your personal information. S/MIME: TouchDown is the only android solution so far that supports sending and receiving S/MIME signed and encrypted emails. S/MIME signing and encryption ensures that your emails are not tampered with, and can ensure that emails you send can be ensured to be visible only to the intended recipient.Manageable : TouchDown integrates with most popular Mobile Device Management solutions in the market today, increasing the chances that your phone can play well with your IT organization's security policies.

reviews.comment: Good app, I installed it cause setting up corp email made me put in a 6 digit password evey 10min on my phone, wouldnt let me just swipe or use pattern pass.  It was really annoying! This app just makes you password into the app, you still get all your email notifications and you can custom ringtones, light color, vibrate patterns...  Really good so far!
reviews.author: Kyle Laloge

reviews.title: Great App, but.......
reviews.comment: Just needs ability to set out of office reply, Then I will give 5 stars. Thanks Nitro Desk
reviews.author: Andre van Staden

reviews.title: Perfect Outlook
reviews.comment: Syncs great with my works owa server and it\'s much better than stock mail app. Well worth the $20. The only drag is you can\'t browse your mail contacts but search and add one at a time.
reviews.author: Bob Chilcote

reviews.title: Latest version is buggy
reviews.comment: Loved app until latest update. Split screen is too much info for phone. Won\'t refresh new folders. When reply, sometimes doesn\'t include info & acts like new msg. Considering going back to stock.
reviews.author: Ansje Miller

reviews.title: It works.
reviews.comment: The application works. I have to continuously put it in classic view mode in order to read any email though. Otherwise it just refuses to open emails.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Smooth and reliable, high price tag.
reviews.comment: Finally an Exchange client that works on my phone. Price is somewhat high, but I didn\'t really have much choice. Action is smooth. Overall I\'m satisfied.
reviews.author: Timo Hannukainen

reviews.title: Needs POP support!
reviews.comment: Sent inquiry as to WHY they don\'t support POP/SMTP. Didn\'t answer that question. Just said this app is for \"corporate\" email and there is no POP support. So I guess if your corporation uses POP YOU ARE JUST OUT OF LUCK.  Me, I\'m out 20 bucks!
reviews.author: Andrea B

reviews.title: Calendar stopped functioning
reviews.comment: A couple of months ago all the appointments and tasks disappeared. Now nothing syncs except email. I have no contacts, no notes, no appointments, no tasks. A bit useless.
reviews.author: Scot Vessell

reviews.title: Notification actions!
reviews.comment: Just got the update with the ability to dismiss or snooze reminders in the notification tray!  Fantastic!!!!
reviews.author: Jason Anton

reviews.title: Mixed reviews
reviews.comment: I am using touch down for last one year however recently I am not getting mail\'s automatically. .Every time I need to sync manually. ...I checked with all the settings. ...any suggestions. ..
reviews.author: Madhanraj Duraiswamy

reviews.title: Really the most valuable app I own
reviews.comment: I have had this app since my OG Droid and I have it on my tablet as well. It has just gotten better. If if had known how much use I was going to get out of it and how well it was going to evolve, I would\'ve gladly paid $50 for it. Developer support remains awesome.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good application. Not so good notification.
reviews.comment: The color combination of notification screen makes it hard to read after the last update. I\'m using the basic theme. Otherwise a good application.
reviews.author: Savin Vasudevan

reviews.title: Impressive
reviews.comment: I have been having issues getting my school email on my EVO 4G, since I cannot encrypt the phone.  TouchDown handled this by installing a certificate, thus bypassing the need to encrypt my whole phone.  This was an easy to configure app and works really well.  I love it and recommend it highly!
reviews.author: Chuck Dirienzo

reviews.title: Notifications hard to read
reviews.comment: The latest update has made the notifications hard to read.  When I receive an email, it is now white text on a grey background.  Other than that, good app.
reviews.author: James Allen

reviews.title: Works
reviews.comment: Sometimes hard to navigate since menus are not consistant (settings) and not intuitive. Classic mode has more options. Have to reset it every few months since it would not update correctly.  notifications are harder to read since text is white on grey.  Poll times during non peak are ignored. I have peak stop at 5:00pm and it will keep pooling as if there were no rules.
reviews.author: Maurice Lin

reviews.title: Widgets are missing
reviews.comment: I have Galaxy S3 and I\'m running Nova launcher, after the installation I realize that I have no widgets of Touchdown.  anyone experience such problem???
reviews.author: Nir Avniel

reviews.title: Great app for work email
reviews.comment: Hey guys.  I like using your app.    Can you please adjust the colors in the notification read and delete buttons.   The text in them is not visible on my device.    Morotolaa RAZR.
reviews.author: Joshua Kosswig

reviews.title: Used to work great
reviews.comment: Latest upgrade ruined it. Mail filing too sensitive and very very or one to fat finger hellish disasters. This version has me convinced to switch phones.
reviews.author: William Jaffe

reviews.title: Nothing works
reviews.comment: I can see my folders but nothing else. No email, no contacts, no calendar items, nothing. All my folders are \"empty\". Not worth the money if I can\'t see anything.
reviews.author: Frank Rustyak

reviews.title: Why?
reviews.comment: Touchdown has been the best Android email client, that is until partnering with airwatch. The six character unlock pin? More importantly why are the email and calendar widgets locked out permanently? The lock should occur at time of access, not phone lock... Please give us more flexibility with airwatch.
reviews.author: Adam Bean
